Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the extent to which the Facebook Messenger app violates privacy conditions.
Understate: The claim may be understating the reasons for requesting certain permissions in the app.
Lack enough support: The claim may lack enough supporting evidence or examples to fully substantiate the privacy-violating conditions.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative messaging apps that request similar permissions, suggesting a potential bias in focusing solely on Facebook Messenger.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that few users read the full Terms of Service before accepting them, which may not be accurate.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that many of the permission requests in the Facebook Messenger app are common and not significantly different from other messaging apps.
Falters at times: The claim may falter in presenting a balanced view of the privacy concerns related to the Facebook Messenger app.
